Summary: Flame type object seen while camping - missing time
divs: sighting detailsi've decided to post this now, even though the event happened nearly 9 years ago. i cannot remember exact dates, but again it was almost a decade ago. my friends and i were camping at the lost park campground around june or july of 1999. as we were sitting around the campfire at approximately 1am we saw a bright reddish light in the distance that seemed to be about a 1\2 mile away from us. the object wasn't in the sky, but closer to the ground. wondering what the light was, two of us took a quick hike to a nearby ridge to get a better look. at first i thought that it was another campfire as the object looked like a flame, but when we got a better look it was clear that the object was floating just above the trees; and it was lighting up the ground below it. it seemed to change shape and dance, sort of like how a flame moves and changes; and its colors were a bright reddish-orange-purple. the object moved very slow and hovered around the same spot. it's movement seemed deliberate, yet not really precise either (hence the 'dancing' motions). i could not distinguish any solid mass or any real shapes, as it literally looked like a flame yet it wasn't made of fire. it seemed to be a flame of light. there was absolutely no sounds from the object. the phenomenon lasted for what seemed like around 10 minutes; and then the object literally shot into the sky at speeds that i didn't think were possible. the next part is was really scares me even to this day. we went back to the campfire and started to talk about what we just saw. i was noticeably tired at this point and when i looked at my watch it was 4am in the morning. some how, three hours had gone by without anyone noticing - and i don't remember going anywhere except for watching the object for 10 minutes. what was a 10 minute experience was actually 3 hours in real time. i just can't explain it. there is no doubt that we were all a bit 'impaired' during the sighting\experience (who camps sober?) - but there is also no doubt that we all experienced the same thing.
